title: Inside the expert network training every frontier AI model | Garrett Lord
key_insights: Ask 'What is the most impactful thing I can do today?' to prioritize effectively across different roles
Have a flexible view of your identity - adapt to what the company needs rather than conforming the job to your preferences
When building products, create entirely new experiences rather than just digitizing what came before
The AI market will consolidate into three segments: frontier models (hyperscalers), tooling (risky due to proximity), and applied AI/agents (biggest opportunity)
Outcome-based pricing aligns incentives and creates true partnerships with customers in AI
Agents represent a fundamental shift from productivity software to autonomous job completion
Choose go-to-market strategy based on whether buyer and user are the same person
Root cause analysis and context engineering are crucial for realizing AI productivity gains today
topics_discussed: Google Local failure and Google Maps success story
Career adaptability across different roles (PM, CTO, CEO)
The future of coding and programming languages for AI
AI market segmentation and startup opportunities
Go-to-market strategies for B2B AI products
FriendFeed creation and like button invention
AI productivity gains and current limitations
Education in the age of AI
Context engineering for AI tools like Cursor
memorable_quotes: The whole market is going to go towards agents. I think the whole market is going to go towards outcomes-based pricing. It's just so obviously the correct way to build and sell software.
I think agent is the new app. I think that's going to be the product form factor.
The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
frameworks_mentioned: Root cause analysis for AI improvement
Go-to-market model selection (developer-led, product-led, direct sales)
recommended_for: Anyone interested in AI agents and automation
summary: Bret Taylor, legendary tech builder and current CEO of Sierra, shares hard-won lessons on product leadership, career adaptability, and building successful AI companies. The conversation covers everything from learning from failures at Google to why agents represent the future of software, with practical insights on go-to-market strategies and outcome-based pricing.
